abstract: New York Yankees manager Joe Girardi announces that starting pitcher Masahiro Tanaka has strained right hamstring and will miss his next start, an important game against Toronto Blue Jays.
lead_paragraph: Tanaka, the Yankees’ best pitcher, has a Grade 1 strain of his right hamstring and will miss his next start — which is Wednesday against the Blue Jays, a team the Yankees are chasing for the American League East title.

headline.main: Muscle Strain Will Keep Masahiro Tanaka From Making a Key Start in Toronto
headline.print_headline: Muscle Strain Will Keep Tanaka From Making a Needed Start in Toronto

snippet: Tanaka, the Yankees’ best pitcher, has a Grade 1 strain of his right hamstring and will miss his next start — which is Wednesday against the Blue Jays, a team the Yankees are chasing for the American League East title.
